intro: Rosa × dumetorum var. quasitomentosa, commonly known as the woolly dog玫瑰, is a hybrid shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its dense, grayish-white fuzzy foliage and stems, which provide a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of pink to white, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
